availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Dishman Walters on October 14, 1851. Father of Cyrass Walters, Cornelia Walters, and William Walters. Laborer in Warren County, Kentucky in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Marshall County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 62A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, p. 152.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Staton District, p. 23.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000164005, p. 530.
Find A Grave, "William B. Walters, Sr‚Äù (1833-1881)," Memorial #34487221, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/34487221 (accessed August 17, 2018).
